instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3437-b no backlight
threads.message: I have a macbook air with no backlight, I get a picture but no backlight, i have no idea where to even start measuring for problems on this thing. There has been no liquid damage on this board at all. thanks for any help you can give

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3437-b no backlight
threads.message: Read the sticky topic on this first and report some measurements.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3437-b no backlight
threads.message: I get 0v on pin 2 of r7731 the bkl_en line. i do get a picture

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3437-b no backlight
threads.message: .582 in diode mode from pin 2 r7731 to ground

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3437-b no backlight
threads.message:
0 on pin 6
0 on pin 5
0 on 4
0 on 3
0 on 2
0 on 1

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3437-b no backlight
threads.message: never mind, im an idiot the fuse must be bad, im getting over 8v on pin 1 of f7700 and 0 on pin 2

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3437-b no backlight
threads.message: Yup replaced f7700 and i now have backlight. Thanks for the help!
